title: New US Ambassador to Sri Lanka sworn in
content: Julie Chung, a former Assistant Secretary of State at the US State Department, has been sworn in as the new US Ambassador to Sri Lanka. Sharing a message on Twitter, Deputy Secretary of State, Wendy R. Sherman added her wishes to the newly sworn-in US Ambassador to Sri Lanka. US President Joe Biden has nominated Julie Chung as the Ambassador to represent the United States in Sri Lanka and the Maldives. Julie Chung, a career member of the Senior Foreign Service, class of Minister-Counselor, is the Acting Assistant Secretary of the Bureau of Western Hemisphere Affairs at the U.S. Department of State. She was previously Director of the Office of Japanese Affairs at the Department.
